intro: Oxyanthus brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth surface. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
